articles.original_title: Beer rationing? Guinness keeps the English waiting
articles.optimized_title: Guinness Supply Dwindles: Liverpool Pubs Ration Beer for Holidays
articles.description: An Irish pub in Liverpool uses an average of 12 50-litre barrels a week. It has now received just half of its order. Across England, there are shortages of the Irish drink. Some bars have been without it since last Friday. Distributors say they are saving up to make it through Christmas and New Year's Eve, especially since the warehouses were emptied during the rugby games.

articles.original_title: My dream was to plant millions of trees and I'm not going to do it alone
articles.optimized_title: Uniting Communities to Plant Millions of Trees in the Andes
articles.description: Local communities living near the Andes in South America were united by the desire to rebuild a forest growing high in the mountains. The indigenous people decided to save the local ecosystem by planting hundreds of thousands of trees there every year.
